thread.title: The Miami rumor mill spins Strong, and the coach laughs
thread.title_full: The Miami rumor mill spins Strong, and the coach laughs

title: The Miami rumor mill spins Strong, and the coach laughs
text:
The Miami rumor mill spins Strong, and the coach laughs 
Texas coach Charlie Strong says he has the best job in college football. Matthew Emmons / USA TODAY Sports Oct 26, 2015 at 1:20p ET 0Shares 
Now that he has a two-game winning streak, a quarterback to build on and finally a little excitement from the fan base and Texas coach Charlie Strong would consider coaching at Miami? 
During his Monday press conference, Strong laughed off a report that he "would listen" if contacted by the Hurricanes, who are looking for a replacement for the fired Al Golden. 
Strong dismissed the report from ESPN college football writer Brett McMurphy and said he has the "best" job in the country. true Texas coach Charlie Strong was asked if he was going to Miami. He started laughing and said he has the best job in the country — Anwar Richardson (@AnwarRichardson) October 26, 2015 Strong said, "They're either ripping me or saying I lost my team." He's laughing about Miami rumors. — Kirk Bohls (@kbohls) October 26, 2015 Strong posed, "Am I the topic on there (ESPN) every week?" Pretty much. — Kirk Bohls (@kbohls) October 26, 2015 
Things have not gone smoothly for Strong in his first year-and-a-half on the job at Texas as he tries to push forward a program that was already in decline during Mack Brown's final seasons. 
McMurphy suggested several factors could lure Strong to Miami, including his frustrations with now working under two school presidents and two athletic directors (current AD Mike Perrin serves on an interim basis), his recruiting ties to South Florida from his days as defensive coordinator at Florida and his wife's ties to the state, she is from Lakeland. 
Texas has won two in a row for the first time this season to improve to 3-4 overall and 2-2 in the conference. After some trying times after a blowout opening loss at Notre Dame and the TCU fiasco, Strong's Longhorns upset then-No. 10 Oklahoma and beat Kansas State last week. 
Overall he is 9-11 at Texas. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
